entry.title: In My Eternal Winter, You Lit the Way to Summer
entry.summary:
Author: Gbeeyeebe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,046Chapters: 2/10Kudos: 19

Summary: Clark doesn‚Äôt catch whatever Bruce Wayne says next because his heartbeat wasn‚Äôt just familiar, he *knew* this heartbeat.He double checks it‚Äôs coming from the right person, because he hopes he‚Äôs wrong, knows he isn't, and there‚Äôs no actual way to prove it because it‚Äôs just his memory but- he knows he‚Äôs right. That heartbeat, he‚Äôd recognize it anywhere, he could never forget it. Having it so close to him, under his ear under the stars. The vivid memory of sweet summer kisses in sticky clothes, bright fresh air lapping at them like waves as they ran, days of studying that left them smelling like books and coffee.Bruce Wayne was his first love.-It took Bruce three months to figure out Superman was Clark Kent. It took him a bit longer to accept that Superman was his high school sweetheart.-Or: the one where Bruce knows Clark Kent is Superman, and Superman doesn't know who Batman is, but he knows Bruce Wayne had a secret identity, and overall Bruce is not having a good time, while Clark is trying to figure out his mixed feelings for his past love or his current crush. (Spoilers: they're also the same person. Clark will also not be having a good time)

entry.title: tying me to you
entry.summary:
Author: Areiton

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,799Chapters: 9/24Kudos: 50

Summary: It was a gauntlet, getting here, and now that he is--now that there is nothing to do but watch the vows being said and the Families reacting, now he can second guess himself. It's done. entry.title: Strangers in the night
entry.summary:
Author: WatercolorAru

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,178Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 65

Summary: It wasn‚Äôt a good year for Clark. He broke up with his girlfriend and Lex Luthor bought the Daily Planet, so he chose to move back to his parent‚Äôs house. Not that he was complaining about that last one. It was complicated, okay? He felt like he had nothing left in Metropolis, but he didn‚Äôt feel like he had a place in Smallville, Kansas either. As always, his existence was lonely, so when he heard about a fair in town, he went, hoping to be cheered up. AKA Bruce was investigating a smuggling ring. There had been museum thefts recently, but his investigations as Batman had shed no light to the matter, so he chose to infiltrate a small carnival, which was, most likely, a stop of stolen objects on their way to the Pacific, all along an overly excited Dick Grayson, who missed the circus life. Based on a Tumblr post by secretidentie

entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,458Chapters: 5/21Kudos: 30

Summary: Clark Kent is fresh out of college, beginning his first job at the Daily Planet, and doing his best to blend into the city around him. It would be simple enough - learning the ropes, chasing leads, keeping his head down - if he weren‚Äôt also quietly saving people in the shadows and trying to control abilities that don‚Äôt come with a manual. Metropolis whispers about a mysterious figure streaking through the night sky. They call him the Blur. Clark never intended to become anyone‚Äôs rumor. It happened anyway. Bruce Wayne arrives in the city chasing those rumors, determined to uncover the truth behind the impossible rescues and the flashes of color across the skyline. He expects a vigilante. He expects a secret. He doesn‚Äôt expect Clark. What begins as polite conversation turns to shared rooftop nights, lingering glances, and a slow pull neither of them planned. As Bruce edges closer to discovering Clark‚Äôs truth, he finds himself facing an even harder question:Is he here to unmask the Blur or is he coming back for the young reporter who keeps ruining his certainty?
